name: Discovering the Flavors of Vegan Thai Cuisine: A Private Cooking Class
dateTime: Yew Chung College of Early Childhood Education
location: è‘µèŠ³, Room K2, 24/F, Block 1 Goldfield Industrial Building 144 -150 Tai Lin Pai Road, NT
about: Embark on a culinary adventure with our exclusive private class, "Discovering the Flavors of Vegan Thai Cuisine," designed for individuals or small groups eager to learn the secrets of traditional Thai cooking while embracing a plant-based lifestyle.In this intimate cooking experience, you'll have the opportunity to work closely with Chef Tina, a talented chef who specializes in vegan Thai cuisine. Together, you'll discover essential Thai cooking techniques, including how to balance flavors, the importance of presentation, and tips for sourcing the best ingredients. You will also gain insights into the health benefits of a vegan diet and how to incorporate more plant-based meals into your everyday life.During this 3-hour class, you will experience how to make a variety of traditional Thai dishes using fresh, local ingredients. Chef Tina will guide you through the process of creating mouthwatering dishes like:Vegan Coconut Mushroom SoupVegan Green Papaya SaladVegan Curry PasteTempeh or mushroom Tofu curryAfter cooking, you can enjoy the delightful dishes youâ€™ve prepared together! Share stories, savor the flavors, and connect with your fellow culinary enthusiasts in a warm and inviting atmosphere. This dining experience is the perfect way to celebrate your culinary creations and enjoy a meal that reflects the rich tapestry of Thai culture.Whether you're a beginner or an experienced cook, this class caters to all skill levels.

about: Join us on this foodie adventure led by a friendly local guide through the vibrant heart of Hong Kong â€“ Old Central, to taste the most authentic traditional Hong Kong cuisine. Within 3 hours, youâ€™ll explore old buildings, ride the cityâ€™s oldest transport, and best of all, taste the mouth-watering street food and drinks Hong Kong is famous for.Tour Availability: DailyMeeting Point: Sheung Wan Exit E2 (Street Level)Duration: 15:00 â€“ 18:00 (approximately 3 hours)Group Size: Max. 15 participantsHighlights:Taste a range of signature dim sum, including Har Gau (crystal shrimp dumpling), Siu Mai (pork and shrimp dumpling), water chestnut cake, and even chicken feet!Try the exclusive Hong Kong street food, like the egg waffle, egg tart, and a refreshing local herbal tea.Dine in a typical Cha Chaan Teng, a Hong Kong-style cafe, and enjoy local favorites like French toast, silk stocking milk tea, and Yuen Yeung (tea and coffee mix).Walk into the antique market and Man Mo Temple, digesting your food with a walk through historical heritages.Enjoy the Michelin commanded Wonton noodles as a finish.

name: An Evening Of All French Experience 3  (ICE Cultural Exploration Series)

name: Vegetarian Food and Cultural Tour
location: Kowloon, Pei ho street Sham Shui Po, KOW
about: Join us on our revamped Vegetarian Food tour for 2024. All food is included in the experience.Hong Kongâ€™s global culinary scene beckons, and for those seeking plant-based delights, our Grass Routes Vegetarian Food Tour is the answer. Join Hong Kong Greeters on a meticulously crafted journey, seamlessly fusing a lesser-known local neighbourhood with delectable vegetarian treats. From a classic breakfast at a local cha chaan teng to savouring iconic street snacks like Cheung faan, bakery delights, and refreshing beverages, prepare to indulge in a morning feast that celebrates both the cityâ€™s rich culture and vibrant vegetarian culinary scene.Vegan-friendly too!Inclusions:Expertly led by a licensed guide and self-confessed foodieIndulge in the delicious and humble flavours with five food stopsHosted in EnglishVegetarian Tour Itinerary:Cha Chaan Teng: Immerse yourself in a local breakfast spot, your one-stop-shop for all the delicious vegetarian Chinese breakfast items.Seasonal fruits (optional): Discover some of the sweetest Asian delights at a local fruit stand.Kung Wo Beancurd Factory: This restaurant has been around for over 100 years for a reason! Let your guide chose some of the best variety of products to try, and take a look at how the beancurd is made in the back kitchen.Cheung Faan Delight: Another local and fully vegetarian favourite â€“ spice up this humble dish with a variety of saucesKing of Drinks: The most refreshing local drink made on the spot just for youPlus a few more local surprises in store for you.*Children must be accompanied by an adult

about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.
